intro: Coronanthera sericea, commonly known as the silky coronanthera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in well-drained environments. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
